history.content: 61b, 16b, 1b is very manageable, especially with your background. Adding R1A might make it a little bit difficult though.
61b, 16b, 1b is very manageable, especially with your backgrund. Adding R1A might make it a little bit difficult though.

Hi there! I just had a small question that I was hoping some of my seniors who've gone through these classes could answer for me. I'm a freshman who's currently taking 61A, 16A, a Breadth, and a Decal (I took a very easy courseload since I was worried Berkeley would be too much for me coming in) and I feel that the workload is pretty stress-free. 16A p-sets are slightly long but everything else is pretty quickly done. For my grades, I'm expecting an A- for 61A and an A for 16A. With that information, how would you consider the workload for taking 61B, 16B, and Math 1B? I'm going to be pairing this with an R1A class to satisfy the L&S requirements. 

One thing worth noting is that as an international student, my high school math class covered a lot of the material in 1B (such as integration techniques and applications, diffeq, etc.) but there are gaps in my knowledge (such as series, specific proofs, etc.) which I am hoping to remedy.
history.subject: Would 61B, 16B, and Math 1B be manageable?
